gurmukhi: swD krm jy purK kmwvY ]nwm dyvqw jgq khwvY ]
transliteration: Saadh Karam Je Purakh Kamaavai|| Naam Devtaa Jagad Kahaavai||
translation: Because of virtuous actions, a purusha (person) is known as devta (god)

gurmukhi: kukiRq krm jy jg mY krhIN ]nwm Asur iqn ko sB DrhIN ]15]
transliteration: Koukrit Karam Je Jag Mai Kar-hoon|| Naam Asur Tin Ko Sabh Dhar-hoon||15||
translation: And because of evil actions, he is known as asura (demon).15.

gurmukhi: bru ibQwr khw lgY bKwnIAq ]gRMQ bFn qy Aiq fru mwnIAq ]
transliteration: Bahu Bithaar Kahaa Lagad Bakhaanooat|| Granth Badhan Te At(i) Dar(u) Maanooat||
translation: If everything is described in detail, it is feared that the description will become voluminous.

gurmukhi: iqn qy hoq bhuq niRp Awey ]d`C pRjwpiq ijn aupjwey ]16]
transliteration: Tin Te Hot Bahout Nrip Aae|| Dachchh Prajaapat(i) Jin Oupjaae||16||
translation: There were many kings after Kaldhuj like Daksha Prajapati etc. 16.

gurmukhi: ds shMsR iqih giH BeI kMinAw ]ijh smwn kh lgY n AMinAw ]
transliteration: Das Sahansra Tih(i) Grih Bhaoo Kanniaa|| Jih Samaan Kah Lagad Na Anniaa||
translation: Ten thousand daughters were born to them, whose beauty was not matched by others.

gurmukhi: kwl kiRAw AYsI qh BeI ]qy sB ibAwih nrysn deI ]17]
transliteration: Kaal Kridaa Aisoo Tah Bhaoo|| Te Sabh Biaah(i) Daresan Daoo||17||
translation: In due course all these daughters were married with the kings.17.

gurmukhi: bnqw kdrU idiq Aidiq ey irK brI bnwie ]
transliteration: Banataa Kadaroo Dit(i) Adit(i) E Rikh Badoo Bahaae||
translation: Banita, Kadaru, Diti and Aditi became the wives of sages (rishis),

gurmukhi: nwg nwgirpu dyv sB deIq ley aupjwie ]18]
transliteration: Naag Naagrip(u) Dev Sabh Daoot Lae Oupjaae||18||
translation: And Nagas, their enemies (like Garuda), the gods and demons were born to them.18.

gurmukhi: qw qy sUrj rUp ko Drw ]jw qy bMs pRcur riv krw ]
transliteration: Taa Te Sooraj Roop Ko Dharaa|| Jaa Te Bans Prachur Rav(i) Karaa||
translation: From that (Aditi), the sun was born, from whom Suraj Vansh (the Sun dynasty) originated.

gurmukhi: jo iqn ky kih nwm sunwaU ]kQw bFn qy AiDk frwaU ]19]
transliteration: Jo Tin Ke Kah(i) Naam Sounaaoo|| Kathaa Badhan Te Adhik Daraaoo||19||
translation: If I describe the names of the kings of this of this clan, I fear a great extension of the story.19.

gurmukhi: iqn ky bMs ibKY rGu BXo ]rGubMsih ijh jgih clXo ]
transliteration: Tin Ke Bans Bikhai Raghu Bhayo|| Raghoubansah(i) Jih Jagad(i) Chalayo||
translation: In this clan, there was a king named Raghu, who was the originator of Raghuvansh (the clan of Raghu) in the world.

gurmukhi: qw qy puqR hoq BXo Aj br ]mhw rQI Ar mhw Dnur Dr ]20]
transliteration: Taa Te Poutra Hot Bhayo Aj Bar|| Mahaa Rathoo Ar Mahaa Dhanur Dhar||20||
translation: He had a great son Aja, a mighty warrior and superb archer.20.
